C

computeDensity(EmpiricalDist, ContinuousDistribution, double, double[]) - Static method in class umontreal.ssj.gof.KernelDensity
Given the empirical distribution `dist`, this method computes the kernel density estimate at each of the @f$m@f$ points Y[@f$j@f$], @f$j= 0, 1, â€¦, (m-1)@f$, where @f$m@f$ is the length of `Y`, the kernel is `kern.density(x)`, and the bandwidth is @f$h@f$.
computeDensity(EmpiricalDist, ContinuousDistribution, double[]) - Static method in class umontreal.ssj.gof.KernelDensity
Similar to method #computeDensity(EmpiricalDist,ContinuousDistribution,double,double[]) above , but the bandwidth @f$h@f$ is obtained from the method getBaseBandwidth(dist) in package `randvar`.
